page.title: 06The Canal Shop (continued)
page.content:
They have to shut down in winter because there is not enough business but sometimes private boats do pass through.
They are cut off where they live and have to get everything themselves. {They spend Â£1020 on petrol a year which covers all their transport costs { The milkman leaves milk about half a {mile away and only delivers when he {comes to collect his bill.
They don't get much chance to go away because they can't afford to shut the shop.{Their last proper holiday {was in 1962.}They have no social life because this also means shutting the shop.
{By Nerys Webster {Sandra Lowe
